quiz.title: Basic Exponent Properties
quiz.subtitle: Unit 9 Quiz 1: Introduction to Exponent Rules
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Applying Product, Quotient, and Power Rules for Exponents

questions.question: Simplify: $x^3 \cdot x^4$
questions.explanation: Product rule: When multiplying with the same base, add the exponents: $x^3 \cdot x^4 = x^{3+4} = x^7$.

questions.question: Simplify: $\frac{y^8}{y^3}$
questions.explanation: Quotient rule: When dividing with the same base, subtract exponents: $\frac{y^8}{y^3} = y^{8-3} = y^5$.

questions.question: Simplify: $(z^2)^5$
questions.explanation: Power rule: When raising a power to a power, multiply exponents: $(z^2)^5 = z^{2 \cdot 5} = z^{10}$.

questions.question: Simplify: $a^5 \cdot a^2 \cdot a$
questions.explanation: Product rule applied multiple times: $a^5 \cdot a^2 \cdot a^1 = a^{5+2+1} = a^8$.

questions.question: Simplify: $p^7 \cdot p^0$
questions.explanation: Any base (except 0) to the 0 power is 1: $p^0 = 1$. So $p^7 \cdot 1 = p^7$.

questions.question: Simplify: $(k^2)^3 \cdot k^4$
questions.explanation: First power rule: $(k^2)^3 = k^6$. Then product rule: $k^6 \cdot k^4 = k^{6+4} = k^{10}$.

questions.question: Simplify: $\frac{(t^5)^2}{t^3}$
questions.explanation: First power rule: $(t^5)^2 = t^{10}$. Then quotient rule: $\frac{t^{10}}{t^3} = t^{10-3} = t^7$.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered the basic exponent rules: product, quotient, and power rules.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Remember: Multiply → add exponents. Divide → subtract exponents. Power to power → multiply exponents.
scoreMessages.50: You're getting the hang of it. Practice identifying which rule to use first. Take it step by step.
scoreMessages.0: Start with the three basic rules: 1) $a^m \cdot a^n = a^{m+n}$, 2) $\frac{a^m}{a^n} = a^{m-n}$, 3) $(a^m)^n = a^{m \cdot n}$.
